result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:13 AM Cases called: 22CF150, 22CF169, 22CF190, 22CF212, & 22CF295. Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kyle Lee Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Kyle Lee Mitchell. Agreement recited by ADA Ross. In 22CF190 Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1,2, & 3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 4 & 5 dismissed and read in. 22CF150, 22CF169, 22CF212, & 22CF295 dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 36 months. Conditions of probation include: Submit DNA sample. Successfully complete Columbia County Drug Treatment Court. 30 days jail, imposed and stayed for treatment court use. Restitution of $2430.91. Costs on count 1 of $518.00, count 2 $268.00, & count 3 $268.00. If defendant successfully completes the treatment court, court will consider early discharge from probation. 91 days jail credit.  9:33 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty Allison Borsheim - request for global
filed by Jamie Ziegler, CCADTC Coordinator re: defendant' meets eligibility criteria
for an Arraignment 7/12/22 at 10:00 A.M.

3:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle Lee Mitchell in court in custody from the Columbia County Jail.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Kyle Lee Mitchell. State calls Witness Sergeant Eric Walters, Portage Police Dept., sworn, 3:51 P.M., testimony taken, 3:59 P.M., Witness excused, Court finds probable cause, binds defendant over for further proceedings, matter to be set for Arraignment,
Arraignment scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
